page.title: 01Gateshead MBC TYNE & WEAR
page.content: Four communities form part of the town's western suburbs with their own local shops and amenities. Seperating each are areas of countryside on which there is a mixture of arable land, woodland and recreational space. Lobley Hill is an area of council and private housing built since the mid 1930's. Whickham still retains a village atmosphere, with its main street and older houses, but has in recent years become a major area of new housing development. Sunniside and Marley Hill retain much of the appearance of former mining villages, although Sunniside has altered most through development in recent years.
